calc.view

Class AsciiView

  • java.lang.Object
    • calc.view.AsciiView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ViewInterface

    public class AsciiView
extends java.lang.Object
implements ViewInterface
    The AsciiView class is used to display a text-based interface on the command line for this application, instead of a GUI.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Alex Cordaro ZDAC051

      AsciiView()

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addCalcObserver(java.lang.Runnable handler)
      Allows an observer (the controller) to listen for expression input events, so that an event handler can be run.
      void addTypeObserver(java.lang.Runnable handler)
      Allows an observer (the controller) to listen for type change events, so the event handler can be run to change the calculator type.
      java.lang.String getExpression()
      Gets the user input stored in the expression field variable.
      void setAnswer(java.lang.String output)
      Sets the answer field variable to the string argument given.

      • addCalcObserver

        public void addCalcObserver(java.lang.Runnable handler)
        Allows an observer (the controller) to listen for expression input events, so that an event handler can be run.
        Specified by:
        addCalcObserver in interface ViewInterface
        Parameters:
        handler - the handler to be run

      • addTypeObserver

        public void addTypeObserver(java.lang.Runnable handler)
        Allows an observer (the controller) to listen for type change events, so the event handler can be run to change the calculator type. The private method menu() is called to initiate displaying the menu interface on the command prompt.
        Specified by:
        addTypeObserver in interface ViewInterface
        Parameters:
        handler - the handler to be run
